text: The Men's 100 metre breaststroke competition at the 2019 World Championships was held on 21 and 22 July 2019.ScheduleStart list Adam Peaty broke the world record with a time of 56.88 in the semi-final, the first man to swim under 57 seconds in this event, and went on to win in the final. ==Records== Prior to the competition, the existing world and championship records were as follows. The following new records were set during this competition. {| class="wikitable" style=text-align:center |- ! Date !! Event !! Name !! Nationality !! Time !!
